meanings.sent1: The government decided to depeople the village to build a new highway.
meanings.sent2: The construction of the new airport will depeople the surrounding neighborhoods.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to depeople the stage in an instant!

meanings.definition: To make a place less populated
meanings.sent1: The wildfire's devastation depeopled the once-thriving forest.
meanings.sent2: The economic downturn has slowly depeopled the small town over the years.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected snowstorm depeopled the streets as everyone rushed indoors.
meanings.sent4: The pandemic's impact depeopled the bustling city centers, leaving them eerily quiet.
meanings.sent5: The alien invasion movie depicted how quickly Earth could be depeopled by extraterrestrial forces.
